audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of marketing campaign function, replicable pattern for marketing performance improvement
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific quantified metric but lacks organization attribution and methodology details. 'Up to 200%' suggests best-case scenario without baseline context
audited_claims.notes: Strong efficiency claim but needs customer attribution for full approval

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear workforce augmentation optimizing marketing analytics and campaign setup processes, highly replicable
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific 10x improvement metric but anonymous source. No methodology provided for how speed improvement was measured
audited_claims.notes: Substantial productivity claim requiring customer validation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Revenue optimization across existing client base, replicable for similar enterprise contexts
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific range provided (5-7%) but 'enterprise clients' remains anonymous. Revenue uplift is measurable but attribution methodology unclear
audited_claims.notes: Material revenue impact claim needs named client validation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimization of customer relationship management and marketing targeting, replicable pattern for customer value enhancement
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific range (15-30%) with clear scope (consent customers) but lacks customer attribution. CLV methodology not specified
audited_claims.notes: Significant CLV improvement requires customer case validation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of advertising spend efficiency, highly replicable marketing function improvement
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific range (40-50%) for well-defined metric (ROAS) but anonymous source. ROAS is measurable but baseline not provided
audited_claims.notes: Strong ROAS improvement claim needs customer attribution

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimization of advertising targeting through predictive analytics, replicable for similar marketing operations
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric (up to 50% ROAS improvement) with process description but 'clients reporting' lacks individual attribution
audited_claims.notes: Detailed process with strong metric but needs named client validation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of analytics workflow efficiency, replicable for retail analytics operations
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific 10x improvement metric with industry context (retailers) but lacks individual organization names
audited_claims.notes: Substantial productivity improvement needs specific retailer attribution

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimization of customer segmentation process, replicable time-saving pattern for marketing operations
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific time savings ('hundreds of hours per year') with client attribution ('According to one client') but client remains anonymous
audited_claims.notes: Quantified time savings with client reference but needs named attribution

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Development time optimization for analytics capability, replicable for similar build-vs-buy decisions
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific development time savings (5 months) with direct customer quote but customer remains anonymous

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage IT resilience and risk

audited_claims.notes: Clear development efficiency gain with customer quote but needs named attribution

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. All claims describe optimization of existing marketing, analytics, and development functions rather than business model transformation. Focus is on efficiency gains, cost reduction, and performance improvement within established processes.
